New Records: The White Sox matched an AL record set by the 1988 Baltimore Orioles by losing 21 games in a row from July 10 to Aug. 5.
The White Sox have used more than 60 players this season, a team record.
Key Match Events: The White Sox lost 4-3 in 13 innings on Wednesday on the road against the Los Angeles Angels.
A Jordyn Adams single in the 13th inning drove in Eric Wagaman from third base with the winning run for the Angels, who rallied to tie the game three times.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore commented on the team's awareness of their poor season and the need to compete every night.
White Sox owner Jerry Reinsdorf expressed extreme unhappiness with the season's results and commended the continued effort of players and staff despite the difficult season.
White Sox general manager Chris Getz mentioned that the club won't be spending big for free agent stars, instead trusting in the growth of its young talent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are enduring the most miserable campaign in modern Major League Baseball history, struggling to avoid setting an MLB season loss record.
The 1962 New York Mets set the MLB record for most losses in a season with 120 while the 2003 Detroit Tigers own the American League record for most defeats with 119.
Chicago's mathematical playoff hopes ended six weeks before the season's end.
The White Sox own MLB worsts with 123 home runs, 470 runs, 449 RBIs, a team .222 batting average and 596 walks allowed while ranking last in the AL with 782 runs allowed and a 4.82 team ERA.
